intro: Spergularia longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in sandy or disturbed soils. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Spergularia longipes is commonly found in coastal dunes and open grasslands, where it plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
